title: FedEx partners with Walgreens, to allow package returns at Walgreens stores
text: FedEx Corp. FDX, -1.60% announced Tuesday a partnership with Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. WBA, -1.06% in which consumers can drop off returns at "thousands" of Walgreens stores nationwide. The rollout of the service will begin in early November. "Shoppers prefer to take their online returns to a physical location, so by expanding FedEx Returns Technology to our broader convenience network with Walgreens, we're enabling merchants and e-tailers to offer more locations for their customers to bring their returns," said Ryan Kelly, vice president of global e-commerce marketing at FedEx. FedEx's stock fell 1.5% and Walgreens shares eased 0.3% in morning trading, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, -0.96% shed 292 points, or 1.1%. The announcement comes a day after United Parcel Service Inc. UPS, -2.07% announced a partnership with Micheals Companies Inc. MIK, -2.31% to allow pick-ups and drop-offs of UPS packages at 1,100 Michaels stores. Separately, Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, -0.77% allows customers to return items through Kohl's Corp. KSS, -0.31% stores.
